Exaggerate: The claim may be seen as an exaggeration because it states that the Trump Tower meeting was "totally legal and done all the time in politics," which may not be entirely accurate.
Lack enough support: The claim lacks sufficient evidence or support to back up the assertion that the Trump Tower meeting was "totally legal and done all the time in politics."
Problematic assumption: The claim assumes that the Trump Tower meeting was solely for the purpose of obtaining information on an opponent, without considering alternative explanations or motives for the meeting.
Exist alternative explanation: The claim does not acknowledge the possibility of alternative explanations or motives for the Trump Tower meeting, such as conspiracy to defraud the government or potential violation of election laws.
Falters at times: The claim may be seen as faltering at times because it presents a simplified and one-sided view of the Trump Tower meeting, ignoring conflicting legal opinions and controversies surrounding the event.
